files.patch:
@@ -36,1 +36,1 @@
-`jcmd` \[*pid* \| *main-class*\] *command*... \| `PerfCounter.print` \| `-f`
+`jcmd` \[*pid* \| *main-class*\] [`-T`] *command*... \| `PerfCounter.print` \| `-f`
@@ -51,0 +51,3 @@
+`-T`
+:   When used, the diagnostic commands output starts with a timestamp.
+

@@ -2,1 +2,1 @@
- * Copyright (c) 2014, 2025, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2014, 2024, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
@@ -116,1 +116,0 @@
-        lines.next(); // skip timestamp

@@ -2,1 +2,1 @@
- * Copyright (c) 2015, 2025, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2015, 2023, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
@@ -57,1 +57,0 @@
-    // 2025-01-01 10:59:59
@@ -62,1 +61,0 @@
-    // 2025-01-01 10:59:59
@@ -68,1 +66,0 @@
-    // 2025-01-01 10:59:59
@@ -117,1 +114,0 @@
-        lines.next(); // skip timestamp
@@ -124,1 +120,1 @@
-                Assert.fail("Failed. Expected line #%d \"%s\" to match \"%s\"".formatted(i, line, expected_lines[i].pattern()));
+                Assert.fail("Failed to match line #" + i + ": " + line);
@@ -137,1 +133,0 @@
-        lines.next(); // skip timestamp
@@ -144,1 +139,1 @@
-                Assert.fail("Failed. Expected line #%d \"%s\" to match \"%s\"".formatted(i, line, expected_lines[i].pattern()));
+                Assert.fail("Failed to match line #" + i + ": " + line);
@@ -157,1 +152,0 @@
-        lines.next(); // skip timestamp

@@ -1,1 +1,1 @@
-Usage: jcmd <pid | main class> <command ...|PerfCounter.print|-f file>
+Usage: jcmd <pid | main class> [-T] <command ...|PerfCounter.print|-f file>
@@ -3,1 +3,1 @@
-   or: jcmd -h                                                    
+   or: jcmd <-h | --help>                                         
@@ -5,1 +5,3 @@
-  command must be a valid jcmd command for the selected jvm.      
+  -T flag ensures the dignostic command begins with a timestamp   
+                                                                  
+  command must be a valid jcmd command for the selected JVM.      
@@ -15,1 +17,1 @@
-  -? -h --help print this help message                            
+  -? -h --help  print this help message
